intro: Eschenbachia globosa, commonly known as the globe sedge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, cylindrical leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Eschenbachia globosa is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive, rounded inflorescences.
